text: {| |} RFA Eddyfirth (A261) was an Eddy class coastal tanker of the Royal Fleet Auxiliary. ==Construction and design== Eddyfirth was launched at Lobnitz & Co.'s Renfrew shipyard on 10 September 1953 and completed on 10 February 1954. The ship had an overall length of and a length between perpendiculars of . Beam was and draft . The ship displaced light and full load, with a capacity of 1650 tons of oil. Two oil fired boilers fed a triple-expansion steam engine rated at and drove a single propeller shaft, giving a speed of .Blackman 1971, p. 376. ==References== * * Eddy-Class Coastal Tankers * Historical RFA Category:Tankers of the Royal Fleet Auxiliary Category:1953 ships
title: RFA Eddyfirth (A261)
